name: Turquoise Irena
description: Males have distinct shiny blue feathers on their back, rump, tail, crown, and nape, while the rest of their body is dark blue with red eyes. Females and young males are uniformly blue-green.
spread_note: South Asia, Palawan, Nusa Tenggara Archipelago (Greater Sunda Islands)
proportions: Body length 16.5–17 cm, tail length 8–8.5 cm, wing length 12 cm, weight 68–74 g
attractions: Individuals, pairs, or small groups stay in the tree canopy, flying in waves from place to place in search of ripe fruits, flowers, nectar, and insects. They enjoy bathing in mountain streams during hot midday hours. Males often call loudly in flight. The female, who is less brightly colored than the male, nests in the tree canopy using a loosely woven twig nest, camouflaged with moss.
breeding: We have been breeding them since 2000 and regularly succeed in reproduction.
localities_title: Sichuan - Pavilion of Birds from the Himalayas
